value.name: New law makes inmates choose electric chair or firing squad
value.description: South Carolina Gov. Henry McMaster has signed into law a bill that forces death row inmates for now to choose between the electric chair or a newly formed firing squad in hopes the state can

value.name: South Carolina death row inmates will choose between firing squad, electric chair for executions
value.description: South Carolina had been one of the most prolific states of its size in putting inmates to death. But a lack of lethal injection drugs brought executions to a halt.

value.name: Troopers investigate single-vehicle fatal crash on I-64, five children injured
value.description: On Friday, May 14, at approximately 8 p.m. Indiana State Police, Posey County Sheriff’s Office, Posey County EMS, and multiple fire departments responded to a single-vehicle crash on I-64 at the 3 mile-marker that claimed the life of an Evansville mother and injured five of her children.

value.name: Coroner names teens killed in Lower Richland shooting, pledges to fight gun violence
value.description: Two teenagers were outside a Lower Richland apartment complex Monday night when at least one gunman fatally shot them, according to Richland County Coroner Naida Rutherford. The shooting has the coroner and a state representative pledging to combat gun violence however they can.
